name: Riad Al Mendili Kasbah

reviews.text: This kasbah really is a piece of paradise. It gets better and better every time I go. I have just come back from my third trip to the kasbah and it feels like home to me now. Vanessa and her attention to every detail always make my stay a perfect one - even during desert storms -. Looking forward to next years sojourn...
reviews.title: Paradise in the desert

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The French hosts are very welcoming (though it helps to have a bit of French!), and their (only) fluent English speaking member of staff, Hassan, was exceptionally helpful and friendly. The room was large and comfortable with a fantastic view of the Atlas Mountains beyond the well-tended gardens and pool. The kasbah-style architecture and decor seems authentic even though I believe it's a very new building. We didn't try the spa but the food was really excellent, served anywhere you like including the roof terrace (with resident cacti and great 360 degree views). My only gripes: the journey to it is along a series of extremely bumpy roads so it's slowing going, the pool looks deceptively large on photos but half of it is only 2 feet deep, and the bathroom in our room was a let down for the price: a very small bath and a pretty poor shower. Ah well, we were generally really impressed and would return here (to a different room perhaps).
reviews.title: A wonderfully relaxing place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This trip was a 40th birthday treat. The resort itself is absolutely beautiful with breathtaking scenery of the Atlas Mountains from your room. The suites were luxurious and very comfortable with a fire being lit upon request in your personal lounge area. The food was of excellent quality and the fact that you could have breakfast brought to your bedroom up until 11am meant that you eat on your own personal terrace overlooking the pool. The staff were attentive, patient and friendly and the owners, Vanessa and Emmanuel (aka Manu) were always around to help and their hospitality is second to none. A basic knowledge of french would be very useful!!
reviews.title: An oasis of tranquility with excellent attention to the smallest of details

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3 nights here was a perfect break, with direct flights from Edinburgh and a driver from the hotel waiting for us at the airport. Great rooms, all with great views of the gardens and mountains beyond, fantastic food and a great welcome from Vanessa & Emmanuel. Website & other reviews have it spot on. Spent one evening in the Medina, but was glad to return to this Oasis. Meals were great, with no huge choice but delicious mix of Moroccan and French food, with the breakfasts especially good, served on private terrace at an time of our choosing.
reviews.title: Great Escape - from cold UK & from manic Marrakesh

reviews.text: When you read a long list of reviews for a newish hotel, all praising it to the hilt, there is always THAT suspicion. Well, rest assured, this place is the real deal. Set in quiet isolation within the arid countryside, this is an oasis in more ways than one, with well maintained grounds (including a large, clean swimming pool) surrounding an elegant Moroccan style villa containing 10 ample rooms facing out to views of the Atlas mountains in the distance. From the large, comfortable beds, through the well-appointed bathrooms, to the finesse of the thoughtful decoration it is obvious that the philosophy of the owners, Emmanuel and Vanessa, is to build their reputation through providing excellence in every aspect of their hotel. The staff are superb, the food is fantastic and varied (if you do not have a sweet tooth ask for a breakfast other than the traditional Moroccan!!) and is served in a number of well-chosen locations around the
reviews.title: Believe what you read - this place really is fantastic !!

reviews.text: This boutique hotel is a small corner of paradise in Marrakech. Situated approx. 40 mins drive from the airport, once you have entered the calm and serene walls of the beautiflly tended garden, you will not want to leave... I certainly didn’t and I love to barter in the bazzars with the best of them. Vanessa, her husband all the staff go out of their way to make you feel at home while at the same time not being intrusive if you just want to relax quietly. They have sucessfully managed to keep the balance between luxury and personality here. In terms of what the hotel looks like....wow! the attention to detail is exquisite. From the spa to the bedrooms, bathrooms and my favourite moroccan knook where I had most of my dinners,it all has to be seen to be believed. Traditional morroccan food for breakfast, lunch and dinner and olive oil from the trees that surround the kasbah. I could go on and on.. Believe the hype it is fantastic........
reviews.title: morrocan tranquility

reviews.text: We booked all ten rooms for a business 'weekend retreat'. This was based purely on the good internet reviews we'd seen, plus recommendations from Moroccan business contacts. From the moment we arrived we knew we'd made an excellent choice: This two year old place is extremely well-designed, and it met all our needs. We now understand why being out in the countryside is the elegant option when visiting Marrakech. The city centre simply does not feel clean by comparison (compare the stench of horse manure at the Jamaa el-Fna square in Marrakech with the pool & gardens of the Al Mendili featuring Hibiscus, Bougainvillea and Olive groves.. it's absolutely no contest. And I don't recall seeing a single insect in 3 days at the Al Mendili). Service was excellent throughout, and owners Emmanuel and Vanessa deserve a lot of credit for assembling such a competent team of eleven staff (cleaners, chefs, pool/garden maintenance and spa service personnel all live on-site and were always there for us as and when we needed them - we chose to leave a good tip for them at the end of our stay). Amal, their tireless and versatile "chef de service" deserved special mention as she looked after us extremely well. You can rely on the hotel to arrange transport (Rashid was excellent), arrange outings (or golf) and recommend restaurants in town just 30 minutes' drive away. Rooms are very secure (with optional heavy shutters if required) and air conditioning units more than adequate. Do not leave without trying the Hammam/Massage combination: the cost is very reasonable and the masseuses were surprisingly good. There's ample evidence on the walls (masks and artefacts) of Emmanuel & Vanessa being raised as expat kids in Libreville. They in turn now have three kids attending the French school in Marrakech, plus a delightful one year old white Samoyed "puppy". Hints: brush up your french before travelling to Morocco, Take this as a recommendation of '"Chez Manu et Vanessa".
reviews.title: just what we wanted

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Manu and Vanessa are delightful hosts making you feel very at home. At the end of a flight and bouncy Taxi ride to be welcomed into their hotel is very refreshing. Only opened 2 years they are working hard to achieve the correct ambience. 12 rooms overlooking the Atlas mountains set in olive groves is hard to beat. The staff are professional yet friendly. The Breakfast freshly made crepes/creme caramel was smoothing to look forward too along with the evening dinner-Home made tagines. You need to have a smattering of French as the hotel attracts lots of French guests and Manu's English needs a little work! As a whole we found Marrakech more expensive than imagined but the hotel and views were the highlight of our trip.
reviews.title: An Oasis overlooking the Atlas mountains

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived late in the evening to Marrakech. Our airport transfer was a godsend. Having negotiated the Moroccan traffic from the back seat, we were glad we weren't in the front seat!
reviews.title: Little gem in the sun

reviews.text: As the roads got narrower and the potholes bigger, we arrived at Kasbah Al Mendili. Beautifully lit walkway upto the grand door, rose bushes on either side.
reviews.title: Enchanting and great spot to chill and and relax

description: As soon as you enter Through the studded wooden gate, kasbah Al Mendili reveals its overwhelming charm to you. Vanessa and Emmanuel will welcome you warmly in their posh and friendly surroundings.
